intro: Taraxacum atonolobum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, elongated leaves and a yellow flower head that develops into a pappus-equipped seed sphere. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, with the leaves used traditionally for their diuretic and digestive benefits. Its distinctive morphology and ecological adaptability make it a common sight in meadows and along roadsides.
